content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the extraction system burner inserter that serves as the source for belt connections. It is located at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Dedicated Factory Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Additional connected Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
– Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden Chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP

ERROR TIPS
────────────
– When connecting transport belts, the target must not be a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always add an inserter that inputs items into the intended entity and use that inserter as the connection target.
– When placing an entity, ensure you are within the required placement range and that the entity is available in your inventory before attempting the placement.
– Verify that all variable names are defined correctly to prevent NameError issues (for example, avoid undefined names such as “target_chest”).
